review: i will not say its a game it feels like a gamebook where you make choices and with every choice you increase or decrease a stat i do like this system a lot what does fall a little bit short is the choices you can make and the runs are pretty similar in some ways   the story and world on the other hand is very interesting and carries this rpg   if you like story and world building and dont mind to replay a bit in your runs from time to time you will enjoy this

review: this game is a very good choicematter game there are a ton of choices a player can take which can lead to different paths this game will force the player to make a very heartbreaking and bad decision because of the players previous choices even though the game shows the player other choices as if it tries to mock the players previous decision which feels really fresh to me and that makes the choices the player has taken feel very important

review: the life and suffering of sir brante is brilliant it truly accomplishes the chooseyourownadventure style of book while being an extremely engaging experience i learned a lot during my first play through and i am excited to see other endings i will say though this game is not for the faint of heart i would underscore the suffering in the title as this game is rather unforgiving and you are often given choices with no good outcome overall a great game
